Ingredients: 

• 1 large eggplant 
• 2 zucchinis 
• 2 red bell peppers 
• 2 yellow bell peppers 
• 2 large tomatoes 
• 1 large onion, finely chopped 
• 4 cloves garlic, minced 
• 3 tablespoons olive oil 
• 2 tablespoons tomato paste 
• 1 teaspoon dried thyme 
• 1 teaspoon dried rosemary 
• Salt and black pepper to taste 
• Fresh basil leaves for garnish 

Procedure: 

1. Start by preparing the vegetables. Wash and peel the eggplant, if desired, and cut it into 
1-inch cubes. Slice the zucchinis into rounds. Core and seed the bell peppers, then cut them into 1-inch pieces. Dice the tomatoes. 
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or a Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. 
3. Add the chopped onion and sauté for about 2-3 minutes until it begins to soften. 
4. Add the minced garlic and continue to sauté for another minute until it becomes fragrant. 
5. Stir in the tomato paste, dried thyme, and dried rosemary. Cook for another 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. 
6. Add the diced eggplant to the pot and cook for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally until the eggplant begins to soften. 
7. Now, add the sliced zucchini and bell peppers. Continue to cook for another 5-7 minutes, allowing the vegetables to become tender. 
8. Stir in the diced tomatoes and cook for an additional 5 minutes, or until the tomatoes release their juices and soften. 
9. Season the ratatouille with salt and black pepper to taste. Adjust the seasoning according to your preference. 
10. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let the ratatouille simmer for 15-20 minutes. The flavors will meld together, and the vegetables will become tender and delicious. 
11. Once the ratatouille is ready, garnish it with fresh basil leaves. 
12. Serve the ratatouille as a side dish or a main course. It's delicious on its own, over rice, pasta, or with a crusty baguette. 


Enjoy your homemade Ratatouille for 5 members, showcasing the flavors of seasonal vegetables in this classic French dish.
